Question: What one small change can I make to improve consistency?
During stand-ups, how often do you share your update in 1–2 clear sentences?
When someone doesn’t understand you, how often do you rephrase simply instead of repeating?
In meetings, how often do you summarize with an action + owner + deadline before closing?
How often do you avoid jargon or slang so everyone follows easily?
When you feel nervous, how often do you still complete your update confidently?
Before starting a task, how often do you ask at least one clarifying question?
When receiving instructions, how often do you confirm by saying “So the deadline is Friday, right?”
If two people give different directions, how often do you check which one to follow?
When requirements are explained, how often do you note down key points?
In meetings, how often do you ask “Can you give me an example?” if something is unclear?
When others speak, how often do you let them finish before responding?
During instructions, how often do you avoid multitasking?
After hearing directions, how often do you repeat back key points to confirm?
In discussions, how often do you acknowledge others’ views?
When someone explains, how often do you show attentiveness?
When you receive an important email, how often do you reply within the same day?
In chats, how often do you reply with full responses instead of just “ok”?
When attaching files, how often do you use clear names?
In emails, how often do you include a greeting and closing?
When unable to respond fully, how often do you send “Received, will revert soon”?
In daily stand-ups, how often do you speak up without waiting to be prompted?
If you disagree with an idea, how often do you express it politely with reasons?
Before presenting, how often do you prepare brief notes?
When giving feedback, how often do you keep it respectful and constructive?
When someone helps you, how often do you thank or acknowledge them?
